> The OP asked how to test multiple paths.  If you only write new code when a test is
> failing, and you work in tiny steps, then each new path is tested when and if it's
> needed to make a test pass.

Since the question was "how to test multiple paths" I assumed that the 
code already existed.  The "test first" method was not applicable in 
this case.

- If you delete the code, you can use test first and achieve 100% coverage.
- If you keep the code, you can't be sure that you achieve 100% coverage 
with your tests.

I also wanted to remind that the goal is not to have 100% covered code 
but 100% bug-free code.

-Vladimir
